channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Bitcoin Jesus’ reaches $50 million deal with DOJ to dismiss tax evasion charges
item.description: Roger Ver’s agreement with prosecutors is the latest sign that President Donald Trump’s administration is scaling back its crackdown on crypto.

item.title: D’Angelo: 14 Essential Songs
item.description: The soul singer, songwriter and producer, who died on Tuesday at 51, released three studio albums of meticulously constructed, vocally ambitious, genr...

item.title: U.S. Attorney Was Forced Out After Clashes Over How to Handle Russia Inquiry
item.description: The departures of Todd Gilbert and his deputy in the Western District of Virginia show the pressure being brought on prosecutors to pursue the preside...

item.title: Israel Pressures Hamas to Return Bodies, but Gaza’s Destruction Poses Challenge
item.description: The Israeli government is considering limits on aid to Gaza to penalize Hamas for not turning over more bodies of former hostages. But devastation in ...

item.title: Dallin H. Oaks Named President of the Mormon Church
item.description: The church, which has more than 17 million members around the world, had been officially without a leader since Russell M. Nelson died.

item.title: Why Israel Won the War
item.description: Israelis went to war to defeat an existential threat — and an existential lie.

item.title: Why the Supreme Court may choose to uphold Trump’s tariffs: ‘It would be incredibly disruptive to unscramble those eggs’
item.description: Reversing Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs stands to upend billions in trade flows and test the limits of presidential power.

item.title: Powell just gave his strongest hint yet that rate cuts are coming, and investors are jubilant: ‘Stage is set for parabolic Q4’
item.description: Powell gave two strong signals that liquidity will soon be injected into the market.

item.title: ‘It was the internet then, it is AI now’: IMF upgrades U.S. growth outlook but sees ‘echoes’ of late ’90s dot-com boom
item.description: IMF chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said “the tariff shock is here, and it is further dimming already weak growth prospects."

item.title: Goldman tells staff it will cut more jobs as AI saves costs
item.description: The bank plans to “constrain headcount growth through the end of the year” and a “limited reduction in roles across the firm,” an internal memo says.

item.title: Madagascar Rejoices After Military Takeover and Impeachment
item.description: The change in power came after Parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina, who faced mounting pressure after weeks of Gen Z protests.

item.title: Israel Pressures Hamas to Return Bodies, but Gaza’s Destruction Poses Challenge
item.description: The Israeli government is considering limits on aid to Gaza to penalize Hamas for not turning over more bodies of former hostages. But devastation in ...

item.title: Military Claims Power in Madagascar After President Is Impeached
item.description: The military in Madagascar assumed power after lawmakers voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina on Tuesday. Mr. Rajoelina had gone into hiding on ...

item.title: ‘A Big Day’: How the U.S. and the Arab World Teamed Up to Seal the Gaza Deal
item.description: The cease-fire talks in Egypt showed that with pressure on Hamas and Israel, seemingly huge impediments could be overcome or set aside.

item.title: What to Know About the Protests in Madagascar
item.description: President Andry Rajoelina appears to have left the country after weeks of protests calling for him to resign.
